data.title: Pinball Wizards Welcome
data.text: Great breakfast tacos and craft beer selection in a pinball themed restaurant. Recommend this if you'd hungry and thirsty morning, noon or night

data.title: Whats not to love about great tap beer, imaginative hot dogs and pinball?
data.text:
Kitche' meets 50's pinball with 21st century beer and elevated hotdogs all served by hot tattoo'd bartenders and servers? I think that sums it up. 

Amazing hot dog selections with Elk and Jalapeno sausages amongst others. Toppings from Kim Chi, tamales, sauerkraut, peppers, onions, red onion compote, crawfish fondue, beef cili, avocado, brie, bacon, pepperoni... the list goes on and on.

As for beer. Well, that changes with great frequency. What that means to you is that the beer is always fresh, always unique and there is always something new to try.

Pinball? THe place is top to bottom decorated with game tops, backs, flippers, you name it. Most of the collection that is being used as decorative only is from a pinball joint in New Orleans that was damaged by the flooding of Katrina. It gives it all a new meaning with a story like that.

The staff... wow. Hot hot hot hot hot! Lovely ladies who are as friendly as they are lovely. Most are inked by the shop next door (who happens to own the joint) and remember nearly everyone they see. Give Flips a try. Their dog friendly fenced in patio is awesome for sunset sittings with a nice breeze blowing through and roll up windows between the patio and restaurant, keeps you connected.

data.title: This is not your basic hot dog place!
data.text: Awesome dark bar inside and even more awesome outdoor patio. Can't wait till summer. You order topping and the choose your brat. Marshmallow soft bread. We had a Cubano - pulled pork, tomato relish, dijonaisse author jalapeño sausage; another with - Brie, curry cranberry mayo and red onion jam with German sausage; and yet another with - beef tamale, queso and pico with Italian sausage

data.title: Hot Dog Heaven
data.text:
Flip's is a great option in Lubbock because it is different and they are good at what they do.  The menu is primarily focused around hot dogs and sausages, but these aren't just your ordinary ball park dogs.  You start off by choosing the type of dog/sausage you want, then the style you want them to dress it up with.  This ranges from something as simple as a chili dog (still one of the best I've had) to something way more exotic like crawfish, pulled pork, slaw, or plenty of other options.  I've tried quite a few and I have yet to find one that wasn't anything less than excellent.  I wanted to try a few more, but I can assure you that one dog and a bag of chips is more than enough to fill you up!

The atmosphere is pretty cool too.  It is centered around a pinball theme and even the tables are old pinball machines (you eat right on the glass). The bar is large and well stocked.  There is an outdoor area you can sit in and the entire place has a really open feel.  Both times I've gone the wait staff was excellent!

data.title: Great Food, drinks atmosphere
data.text:
Flips is a very cool place. They have great drinks, a very cool atmosphere and serve up a variety of hotdogs. 

If you find yourself on avenue Q and want a drink, a dog or to check out a pinball inspired bar, check this place out. 

Finally, the staff was really friendly and attentive. I recommend.
